question: If an individual 30 amp branch circuit feeds a single non-motorized equipment receptacle, then the receptacle amperage must be which of the following:
Conductors run in parallel raceways must have equipment grounding conductors which are which of the following:

options.c: Run in parallel in each raceway

correct_answer_text: Run in parallel in each raceway

question: A surge arrester of less than 1000 volts nominal shall have a ground connecting conductor which is no smaller than which of the following sizes:
When there is more than one nominal voltage system in the building, ungrounded feeder conductors must be which of the following:
Single-point grounding is allowed at the source of a separately derived system when which of the following conditions exists:

options.a: A separate equipment grounding conductor is provided at each building and enclosure
options.b: The neutral is insulated and isolated from earth, except at one location
options.c: An equipment grounding conductor is run with the phase conductors

question: The permitted identification of a size 14.0 sq mm or smaller insulated grounded conductor is which of the following:

options.b: Three yellow stripes down the length of a green insulated conductor
options.c: One blue stripe on a gray insulated conductor

question: Branch circuits shall not be derived from autotransformers unless which of the following exist:

options.a: The grounded conductor is protected from access by unauthorized personnel.
options.b: The autotransformer operates at less than 600 volts nominal.
options.c: The circuit supplied has a grounded conductor that is electrically connected to a grounded conductor from the system that supplies the autotransformer.

correct_answer_text: The circuit supplied has a grounded conductor that is electrically connected to a grounded conductor from the system that supplies the autotransformer.

question: A two-wire AC circuit with two ungrounded conductors is permitted to be tapped from ungrounded conductors of circuits that have which of the following:

The minimum size of an equipment grounding conductor used to ground equipment with an automatic over current device rated at 20 amps in the circuit ahead of the piece of equipment is which of the following:
Electrical systems that are grounded must meet which of the following requirements:

options.a: Be connected to the earth in a way that limits the voltage caused by line surges
options.b: Be connected to the earth in a manner that will stabilize the voltage to the earth during normal operation

question: An electric 9 kW range shall have a minimum branch circuit size of which of the following:
In a separately derived system, the TVSS shall be connected in which of the following manners:

options.b: Outdoors, in an easily accessible location
options.d: To the load side of the first overcurrent device

correct_answer_text: To the load side of the first overcurrent device

question: A TVSS device shall not be installed under which of the following conditions:

options.b: If the TVSS is less than the maximum continuous phase-to-phase power frequency that exists at the point of application
options.c: On circuits in excess of 600 volts

question: A 125 volt single-phase kitchen counter receptacle must meet which of the following requirements:
A surge arrestor may be installed under which of the following conditions:

options.b: On a service less than 1000 volts with a grounding electrode for the service

correct_answer_text: On a service less than 1000 volts with a grounding electrode for the service

question: An impedance grounded neutral system is permitted to be installed if which of the following conditions is met:

options.a: If installed to serve a line-to-neutral
options.b: If installed outside in an easily accessible location
options.c: Ground detectors are installed on the system

correct_answer_text: Ground detectors are installed on the system

question: Multi-wire branch circuits are permitted to supply which of the following:

options.b: Only one piece of utilization equipment

question: The minimum size of an equipment grounding conductor used to ground equipment with an automatic overcurrent device rated at 40 amps in the circuit ahead of the piece of equipment is which of the following:
The size of the sole connection of a grounding electrode conductor connected to a concrete-encased electrode shall not be required to be which of the following:

options.b: Connected to an electrode encased by at least 50 mm of concrete

question: For a 30 amp receptacle connected to a 30 amp branch circuit supplying two or more outlets, the total cord-and-plug load may not exceed which of the following sizes:
An equipment grounding conductor that is run with circuit conductors is permitted to be which of the following:
Circuits over 120 volts but not exceeding 277 volts between conductors shall be permitted to supply power to which of the following:

options.a: The auxiliary equipment of electric-discharge lamps mounted in permanently installed fixtures
options.b: Luminaries equipped with mogul-base screw shell lamp holders

correct_answer_text: Luminaries equipped with mogul-base screw shell lamp holders

question: The minimum size copper circuit wire for a 20 amp branch circuit conductor is which of the following:
Restricted-access, adjustable-trip circuit breakers must meet which of the following requirements:

options.a: Have a removable and sealable cover over the adjusting means
options.b: Be located behind bolted equipment covers
options.c: Be accessible only to a qualified person by means of a locked door

question: The laundry area in a single-family dwelling unit must have which of the following:

options.a: A minimum of one 20 amp and one 220 amp receptacle
options.c: At least one receptacle installed within 3 feet of the washing machine location
options.d: A minimum of two GFCI receptacles

question: If a feeder conductor carries the total load supplied by the service conductors with an ampacity of 50 amps, then which of the following standards must be met:

options.a: The feeder ampacity must be greater than the service conductor ampacity
options.b: The feeder ampacity must be less than the service conductor ampacity
options.c: The feeder ampacity must be 30 amps

question: Where more than one building exists on the same property under single management, additional feeders or branch circuits are permitted to supply which of the following:
The use of 5-wire feeders is which of the following:

options.b: Restricted to installations over 600 volts nominal
options.c: Requires that the overcurrent device protection be 100% of the continuous load
options.d: Permitted to use a common neutral

correct_answer_text: Permitted to use a common neutral

question: DC power systems located on the premises must include which of the following:

options.a: A grounding connection at the power source
options.b: A grounding electrode conductor which is at least #10 AWG

correct_answer_text: A grounding connection at the power source

question: The non current-carrying metal parts of equipment shall be considered effectively grounded by use of which of the following methods:

options.a: If it is secured to the structural metal frame of a building
options.b: By use of a separate grounded circuit conductor, running in a separate raceway

question: An electrode that is permitted as a grounding means is which of the following:
The grounded conductor for a single-phase 3-wire AC premises wiring system shall be which of the following:
The circuit breakers used for overcurrent protection of 3-phase circuits must have a minimum of three overcurrent relay elements that meet which of the following requirements:

options.a: Are operated from three current transformers
options.b: Have a neutral which is regrounded on the load side of the circuit
options.c: Have a series rating of 125% of the total circuit load

correct_answer_text: Are operated from three current transformers

question: A fuse must be connected in a manner that meets which of the following requirements:

options.b: In series with each ungrounded conductor
options.c: On the secondary side of a transformer

question: Each set of conductors that feeds separate loads of a transformer secondary shall be connected in which of the following methods:

options.a: With an overcurrent device on the multioutlet line of the branch circuit
options.c: Without overcurrent protection at the secondary

correct_answer_text: Without overcurrent protection at the secondary

question: A single-point grounded neutral system may include which of the following:

options.b: A bonding jumper that connects the equipment grounding conductor to a grounding electrode conductor
options.c: A grounding electrode conductor that connects the grounding electrode to the system neutral

question: Service equipment electrical continuity shall be ensured by which of the following:

options.a: Bonding equipment to the neutral conductor

question: If the use of multiple grounding connections results in objectionable current, which of the following alterations is permitted:

options.a: Change the location of the grounding connections
options.b: Discontinue one or more, but not all, of the grounding connections

question: A feeder overcurrent device that is not readily available shall be installed in which of the following manners:

options.a: Branch circuit overcurrent devices must be installed on the load side
options.b: Branch circuit overcurrent devices shall have a lower ampacity rating than the feeder overcurrent device
options.c: Branch circuit overcurrent devices must be installed in a readily accessible location

question: Open conductors that are not service entrance cables shall not be installed less than which of the following:
Ground-loop currents flow if the neutral-to-ground connections are made in which of the following ways:

options.a: On the feed side of separately derived systems
options.b: On the load side of service equipment or separately derived systems
options.c: In front of the overcurrent protection device

correct_answer_text: On the load side of service equipment or separately derived systems

question: The metal disconnecting means at a remote building, supplied by a feeder with an equipment grounding conductor, is required to be which of the following:

options.a: Connected on the service load side of the feeder
options.b: Buried not less than 3 feet under the ground

question: Circuit conductors that supply power conversion equipment included as part of an adjustable-speed drive system must have an ampacity of which of the following:

options.a: At least 125 percent of the motor's full-load current
options.b: Not less than 125 percent of the rated input to the power conversion equipment
options.c: Not less than 50 percent of the maximum ampacity listed on the equipment nameplate

correct_answer_text: Not less than 125 percent of the rated input to the power conversion equipment

question: The disconnection means for a 400 volt motor circuit must have an ampere rating of which of the following:

options.a: At least 125 percent of the motor's full-load current
options.b: Not less than 115 percent of the full-load current rating of the motor
options.d: Equal to or greater than that the ampacity listed on the motor equipment

correct_answer_text: Not less than 115 percent of the full-load current rating of the motor

question: A 15 amp receptacle that is installed in a wet location must meet which of the following installation requirements:

options.a: Be protected from rain or water runoff
options.b: Have an attachment plug cap inserted
options.c: Have an enclosure that is weatherproof

correct_answer_text: Have an enclosure that is weatherproof

question: Receptacles are considered grounded by which of the following methods:

options.a: When the grounding contacts are connected to the equipment grounding conductor of the circuit that supplies the receptacle
options.b: If the receptacle ground wire is terminated under a metal screw
options.c: When wired to a cord connector
options.d: When the grounding contacts have been effectively grounded

correct_answer_text: When the grounding contacts are connected to the equipment grounding conductor of the circuit that supplies the receptacle

question: Installations for the electrical heating of a pipeline must:

options.b: Include caution signs posted at frequent intervals along the pipeline
options.c: Be identified as being suitable for the chemical, thermal and physical environment of the installation

question: An industrial control panel supply conductor shall have an ampacity of which of the following:

options.a: No less than 125% of the full-load current rating of all resistance heating loads and no more than 125% of all combined continuous loads
options.b: No less than 125% of the full-load current rating of all resistance heating loads plus 125% of the full-load current rating of all other connected motors based on their duty cycle if they are all in operation at the same time
options.c: No less than 125% of the full-load of two or more components of a systematic assembly
options.d: Not to exceed the ampacity listed for all resistance heating equipment and connected motor nameplates

correct_answer_text: No less than 125% of the full-load current rating of all resistance heating loads plus 125% of the full-load current rating of all other connected motors based on their duty cycle if they are all in operation at the same time

question: In order to guard exposed live motor parts and controllers operating at 50 volts or higher from accidental contact, which of the following methods must be used:

options.a: Equipment is installed in a room that is only accessible by a qualified person
options.b: Equipment is installed on a balcony that is elevated enough to prohibit access by unqualified people
options.c: Equipment is installed or mounted at least 8 feet above floor level

question: When a transformer is used to create a three-phase, four-wire distribution system from a three phase, three-wire ungrounded system, the transformer must meet which of the following installation requirements:

options.a: The transformer must not be switched
options.b: The transformer must be directly connected to the ungrounded phase conductors
options.c: The transformer shall not be provided with overcurrent protection that is independent from the main switch and common-trip overcurrent protection for a three-phase, four-wire system

question: A factor that would affect conductor ampacity is which of the following:

A protective device used for limiting surge voltages by discharging surge current and that prevents continued flow of follow current while still remaining capable of repeating these functions is considered which of the following:
Alternating current may be increased or reduced by using which of the following:
Which of the following conductors has one or more layers of non-conducting materials that are not considered insulation:
Conductor sizes are listed as which of the following:

options.a: stranded conductor are expressed in area in sq mm while solid conductor are expressed in Diameter in mm

correct_answer_text: stranded conductor are expressed in area in sq mm while solid conductor are expressed in Diameter in mm

question: The primary purpose for using thermal overload relays for polyphase induction motors is to protect against which of the following:
A multi-wire branch circuit protected by fuses may supply which of the following:
Excluding those in the mains, the maximum number of overcurrent devices permitted in a single lighting and appliance panelboard is which of the following:
Rigid nonmetallic conduit shall be permitted to have a total number of quarter bends in one run that does not exceed which of the following:
Which of the following shall be used to connect the grounding terminal of a grounding receptacle to a grounded box:
The residual voltage of a capacitor must be reduced to which of the following voltage levels within one minute after the capacitor is disconnected from the power source:
If an installation has two 2-wire branch circuits then the service disconnecting means must be rated at not less than which of the following:
The ampacity of a conductor must be derated where the ambient temperature exceeds which of the following:
The type of switch required in each location to independently control a light fixture from two different locations is which of the following:
Which of the following means is not used to fasten equipment to concrete:
A lamp that is 1000 watt, 120-volt will use the same amount of energy as a 14.4 ohm resistor at which of the following:
In electrical construction, mica is most commonly used for which of the following:
If an enclosure is supported by a suspended ceiling system, then it shall be fastened to the framing by which of the following methods:
Which of the following shall not be used in wet or damp locations:
Removing which of the following from conduit threads will ensure electrical continuity between conductors:
A panel may have from 2 to 6 disconnecting means, but which of the disconnect means listed below is permitted to be remote from the others:
A freestanding office partition is permitted a maximum of how many 15 amp receptacles:
If a transformer vault is not protected by an automatic sprinkler system, then it must have a minimum fire resistance and structural strength of which of the following periods of time:
Switches, panelboards, wireways and transformers are allowed to be mounted above or below one another if which of the following conditions exists:

options.a: They don't extend more than 10 mm beyond the front of the equipment.
options.b: No piece of equipment is rated over 300 volts.
options.c: They are flush along the front edge.

correct_answer_text: They don't extend more than 10 mm beyond the front of the equipment.

question: Aluminum enclosures and fittings are allowed to be used with which of the following:
Any 125 volt single-phase receptacles must be protected by ground fault circuit interrupters if they are within which of the following distances from the inside wall of a hot tub:
The neutral conductor in an electrical installation has which of the following qualities:

options.c: It does not apply ampacity correction.

question: Receptacles must be of the grounding type if they are installed on which of the following:
In a corroded electrical connection, high spot temperature is caused by which of the following:

options.a: Increase in the voltage drop across the connection
options.c: Decrease in the resistance of the connection
options.d: Ampacity that is too high for the connection

correct_answer_text: Increase in the voltage drop across the connection

question: A switch is used for which of the following purposes:
Which of the following has the highest electrical resistance:
Which of the following is the term for the ability of a material to allow the flow of electrons:
Although silver, gold, and copper are all excellent conductors of electricity, copper is the most commonly used for which of the following reasons:

options.c: Its ability to bond with a wider variety of materials

question: The term "open circuit" describes which of the following conditions:

options.b: All parts of the circuit are not in contact.
options.c: There is no disconnecting means applied.
options.d: The circuit is experiencing voltage variations or drops.

correct_answer_text: All parts of the circuit are not in contact.

question: A machinery limit switch is used for which of the following purposes:

options.a: To close the circuit when the current exceeds a preset limit
options.b: To open the circuit when temperature reaches a preset limit
options.c: To open the circuit when travel reaches a preset limit

correct_answer_text: To open the circuit when travel reaches a preset limit

question: Conduit installations should not have which of the following:

options.c: A high point at an outlet

question: A fuse under normal load would most likely become hot because of which of the following conditions:

options.a: The rating of the fuse is too low for the application.
options.b: Insufficient pressure at the fuse clips
options.c: A surge in power has occurred.

correct_answer_text: Insufficient pressure at the fuse clips

question: One receptacle on a single branch circuit must have which of the following ratings:

options.b: 100 percent of the branch circuit rating

correct_answer_text: 100 percent of the branch circuit rating

question: A service disconnect means shall be installed in which of the following locations:

options.a: At the nearest point of entrance to a structure
options.b: Within 3 feet of the electrical panel
options.c: Inside or outside of a building

correct_answer_text: Inside or outside of a building

question: Wooden plugs shall not be used to mount electrical equipment to which of the following types of material:
All wiring must be installed so that when complete the installation:

options.b: Is free of shorts and unintentional grounds
options.c: Allows for future expansion of the electrical system or components

correct_answer_text: Is free of shorts and unintentional grounds

question: A conductor must be sized in accordance with which of the following requirements:

options.a: No less than 100 percent of the noncontinuous load
options.b: No less than 100 percent of the noncontinuous load, plus 125 percent of the continuous load
options.c: No greater than 125 percent of the continuous load
options.d: No less than 125 percent of the continuous load

correct_answer_text: No less than 100 percent of the noncontinuous load, plus 125 percent of the continuous load

question: A device that establishes an electrical connection to the earth is which of the following:
A premises wiring system with power derived from a source of electric energy or equipment other than a service is considered to be which of the following:
Which of the following colors of insulation or markings are not allowed to Identify hot phase conductors:

options.a: Black and red for 120/208 volt systems
options.b: Yellow or orange for 277/480 volt systems

question: In a high-leg delta arrangement on a switchboard with bus bars, phase B would have which of the following:
A 200 amp service entrance equipment located indoors at a single-family dwelling must meet which of the following requirements:

options.b: Use bolt-in fuses or circuit breakers

question: The demand factor for three commercial kitchen loads is which of the following:
The total resistance in resistors connected in series is which of the following:

options.a: Equal to the largest resistor in the series
options.b: Equal to the sum of all of the individual resistance values
options.c: The sum of all of the resistance values divided by the number of resistors in the series

correct_answer_text: Equal to the sum of all of the individual resistance values

question: A fixture with a combustible material shade shall not be installed in locations where temperatures exceed which of the following:
